app.util

Class FileHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • app.util.FileHelper

  • public class FileHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class for handling file operations in the application.

    This class provides methods for opening files, checking for errors, and loading tables from files.

    It also contains helper methods for reading table names and creating table tabs in the main window.

    • Field Summary

      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String FILE_NAME
      The default file name for output.

    • Constructor Detail

    • Method Detail

      • openFile

        public static java.io.File openFile(java.lang.String filePath)
        Opens the file at the specified path and returns it. If the file does not exist or is a directory, an error message is displayed in the console.
        Parameters:
        filePath - The path to the file to be opened.
        Returns:
        The File object representing the opened file, or null if the file does not exist or is a directory.

      • checkErrors

        public static boolean checkErrors(java.io.File file,
                                  javafx.scene.text.TextFlow consoleTextFlow)
        Checks the file for errors and displays them in the console. If the file starts with '!', the content is read and displayed as an error message.
        Parameters:
        file - The file to be checked.
        consoleTextFlow - The console TextFlow where the error messages are displayed.
        Returns:
        true if the file contains errors, false otherwise.

      • hasTablesInOutput

        public static boolean hasTablesInOutput(java.lang.String outputFilePath)
        Checks if the output file contains tables. If the file contains more than one line, and it is not '!', it is considered to contain tables.
        Parameters:
        outputFilePath - The path to the output file.
        Returns:
        true if the file contains tables, false otherwise.

      • loadTablesFromFile

        public static boolean loadTablesFromFile(java.lang.String fileName,
                                         boolean isSelectQuery)
        Loads tables from the specified file and creates tabs for each table in the main window. If the file is a SELECT query, the first line is skipped. If the file contains multiple tables, each table is separated by a line starting with a tab character. The tables are created as TableView objects and added to the result tab pane.
        Parameters:
        fileName - The path to the file containing the tables.
        isSelectQuery - true if the file was created by a SELECT query, false otherwise.
        Returns:
        true if tabs were created, false otherwise.

      • readTableNames

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> readTableNames(java.lang.String fileName)
        Reads the table names from the specified file and returns them as a list. The table names are lines starting with a tab character.
        Parameters:
        fileName - The path to the file containing the table names.
        Returns:
        A List of table names read from the file.

      • writeErrorToFile

        public static void writeErrorToFile(java.lang.String errorMessage,
                                    java.lang.String fileName)
        Writes an error message to a file, starting with an exclamation mark.
        Parameters:
        errorMessage - The error message to write.
        fileName - The name of the file to write to (default is "error_output.txt").

      • writeErrorToFile

        public static void writeErrorToFile(java.lang.String errorMessage)
        Overloaded method that uses the default file name.
        Parameters:
        errorMessage - The error message to write.
